JobFullDesc:
About Network Strategy & Operations
It begins with a Card Member using their American Express Card at one of our ATM partners around the world—the rest is up to us. The Network Solutions & Operations team (NS&O) is at the heart of the American Express enterprise—powering millions of transactions through our global payments processing network, which we develop and manage.
NS&O is unique within the enterprise. We work across almost every business unit within the organization as well as interacting with external partners, providers, and key industry stakeholders. We are known to be intellectually curious and problem solvers as we tackle the most imperative initiatives facing the payments industry today like securing online transactions and enabling faster, more convenient ways to pay. A role within NS&O will challenge you to broaden your skillset and industry acumen, while giving you the chance to be part of driving enterprise growth and helping deliver on our brand promise of trust, security and service.
The Global ATM team within NS&O drives strategic direction, signs new partnerships, develops capabilities and manages relationships with 200 external partnerships.
Reporting to Director Global ATM Product, the Product Manager position is an exciting opportunity for a talented project manager to help drive the continual growth of the ATM business, highlighting opportunities and capabilities. Making our strategy a reality through driving global or local project, using data to highlight opportunities and developing clear use cases and value stories for the ATM product.
Key responsibilities of the role will include:

Be the ATM business lead across a number of core projects, providing tactical direction and delivery.
Engage with key stakeholders across American Express to understand customer needs and identify, prioritize, and plan delivery of new capabilities with product owners, in particular respect to debit.
Build a detailed level understanding of the external ATM marketplace, industry players, competitor activity and new emerging trends and functionality to inform the ATM strategic roadmap.
Proactively identify, articulate and drive opportunities to meet new Debit CM needs at the ATM
Use internal and external data sources to drive new capabilities such as ATM contactless
Owner of the ATM locator, web-based tool, including strategic direction, execution of enhancements and ensuring integrity of data
Responsible for aspects of ATM data and reporting

Skills & Experience:

Experience in Product Management and Development including creation of multi-year strategic roadmap and developing feasibility assessments for new products and capabilities.
Very strong project management skills, with the proven ability to lead a number of projects at the same time
Outstanding relationship and collaboration skills, ability to influence a broad group of stakeholders across the organisation, at all levels.
Strong analytical skills, business acumen and ability to think strategically and logically, and to structure & process information into meaningful and actionable recommendations.
High-intellectual curiosity, creative & critical thinker with the ability to understand new concepts quickly, deal with ambiguity and experience in complex problem solving and strategic thought leadership.
Exceptional written and verbal communication and ability to create compelling presentations to effectively and succinctly deliver a message.
Diplomatic ability to influence others at all levels of the business
Understanding of Agile methodology and practices
High energy, an optimistic attitude, and a good sense of humour

Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.
